security_module.description: Configures the syslog daemon to not accept messages from other systems.

security_module.name: Disable Restorecon
security_module.description: Disables the SELinux Restorecon daemon. This deaemon monitors a list of files which are frequently created or modified on running systems, and whose SELinux contexts are not set correctly. The restorecond program is fairly simple, so it brings low risk, but, in its default configuration, does not add much value to a system. An automated program such as restorecond may be used to monitor problematic files for context problems, or system administrators may be trained to check file contexts of newly-created files.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: Disable Remote Exec (rexec)
security_module.description: Disables rexec, which is one of the "r-commands" (rexec, rlogin, rsh) that use unencrypted protocols and are subject to network sniffing and hijacking. Additionally, they have a number of well-known weaknesses in their authentication scheme.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: Disable Rhnsd
security_module.description: The rhnsd daemon polls the Red Hat Network web site for scheduled actions. Unless it is actually necessary to schedule updates remotely through the RHN website, it is recommended that the service be disabled.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: Disable Remote Login (rlogin)
security_module.description: Disables rlogin, which is one of the r-commands (rexec, rlogin, rsh) that use unencrypted protocols and are subject to network sniffing and hijacking. Additionally, they have a number of well-known weaknesses in their authentication scheme.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: Disable RPC Keyserv
security_module.description: Disables the Solaris RPC encryption key storage service. The keyserv(1M) is a daemon that is used for storing the private encryption keys of each user logged into the system. These encryption keys are used for accessing secure network services such as secure NFS and NIS+.

security_module.name: Disable Remote Shell (rsh)
security_module.description: Disables rsh, which is one of the r-commands (rexec, rlogin, rsh) that use unencrypted protocols and are subject to network sniffing and hijacking. Additionally, they have a number of well-known weaknesses in their authentication scheme.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: Disable SETroubleshoot
security_module.description: Disabling the SETroubleshoot service will prevent desktop users from being notified of SELinux deials. On Red Hat systems, the SETroubleshoot service reports denials in a in a user-friendly fashion but SELinux errors may provide important information about intrusion attempts in progress, or may give information about SELinux configuration problems which are preventing correct system operation.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: Disable SMART Disk Monitoring Support
security_module.description: Disable SMART disk monitoring support (smartd). SMART (Self-Monitoring, Analysis, and Reporting Technology) is a feature of hard drives that allows them to detect symptoms of disk failure and relay an appropriate warning. Leave this service running if the system’s hard drives are SMART-capable otherwise, disable it.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: Disable SNMP
security_module.description: Disables SNMP, which is a protocol used for network management.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: Disable MySQL
security_module.description: Disables the MySQL database server.

security_module.name: Disable Postgresql
security_module.description: Disables the PostgreSQL database server.

security_module.name: Disable Solaris Volume Manager
security_module.description: Disables the Solaris Volume Manager (SVM) services. This module disables the SVM initialization, multipath upgrade, and monitor services.

security_module.name: Disable Solaris Volume Manager GUI
security_module.description: Disables the Solaris Volume Manager (SVM) graphical user interface (GUI). Specifically, this module will disable SVM multi-node communications (mdcomm), remote metaset (meta), remote mediator (metmed), and remote multihost disk (metamh) services.

security_module.name: Disable Login Prompts on Serial Ports
security_module.description: Disables the login prompt on the system serial devices to make it more difficult for unauthorized users to attach modems, terminals, and other remote access devices to these ports.

security_module.name: Disable Smart Card Support
security_module.description: Disable the pcscd service which provides support for Smart Cards and Smart Card Readers.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: Disable Telnet
security_module.description: Disables Telnet, which uses an unencrypted network protocol that allows passwords to be stolen by network eavesdroppers or the session to be hijacked by outsiders.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: Disable Webmin
security_module.description: Webmin allows remote administration over HTTP. Webmin, and other tools like it, can be dangerous as they have a history of bad authentication or session management.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: Disable XFS
security_module.description: Disables the X Window System font server (XFS) which supplies fonts to X Window System display servers.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: Enable Crond
security_module.description: The cron daemon (crond) is responsible for executing scheduled commands, and is used by many system routines to perform routine maintenance. It is recommended that this service always be on.

security_module.name: Enable Ip6tables
security_module.description: The ip6tables daemon is responsible for providing host-based firewall capability for IPv6 and ICMPv6. It is recommended that this service always be on.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: Enable Iptables
security_module.description: The iptables daemon is responsible for providing host-based firewall capability for IPv4 and ICMP. It is recommended that this service always be on.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: Enable postfix
security_module.description: The postfix daemon is responsible for local mail delivery, and is essential to many maintenance and notification activities. It is recommended that this service always be on.

security_module.name: Ensure YUM repositories use gpgcheck
security_module.description: Yum repositories should have the 'gpgcheck=1' settings made to require all packages within each repository are digitally signed, so that package authorship can be verified..

security_module.name: Prohibit DHCP client dynamic DNS updates
security_module.description: Configure the DHCP client from sending any dynamic DNS updates.

security_module.name: Screen Package Installed
security_module.description: The screen package provides a locking capability to any tty device, analogous to a graphical screen lock. It is recommended that this service be installed.

security_module.name: Block System Accounts
security_module.description: This module locks specific system accounts. The module first uses the passwd(1) to obtain the account's password status. If the status is not one of 'LK', 'NP', or 'NL' it is considered not blocked. The module then uses the passmgmt(1M) command in Solaris and the usermod(8) to lock the account.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: Default umask
security_module.description: Sets the default umask so that newly created files or directories are only accessible by the user who created them.

security_module.name: Disable Rhosts Support
security_module.description: Disables support for .rhosts files. Some login services (such as rlogin or rsh) can optionally use .rhosts files for authentication.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: Home Directory Contents
security_module.description: Ensures files and directories inside user home directories are secured.

security_module.name: Home Directory Ownership
security_module.description: Sets user and group ownership of normal users to the primary user and group identified in the user account. In Linux, this module only handles user accounts with an identification number between 500 and 65534. In Solaris, this module only handles user accounts with an identification number between 100 and 65534.

security_module.name: Home Directory Permissions
security_module.description: Configures user home directories to have file permissions that prevent all access by other users, while also preventing write access by users in the same group.

security_module.name: Expired Password Invalidation
security_module.description: Sets the inactivity interval to seven days. The account is locked if there is no activity on the account for seven days after the account's password expires. Once locked, the account cannot be used until an administrator unlocks it. This prevents old accounts from being used by an attacker.

security_module.name: Lock Invalid Accounts
security_module.description: Locks any non-system user account that has an invalid configuration.

security_module.name: Remove rsh authorization files
security_module.description: Remove any /etc/hosts.equiv file and the .rhosts file from all local users home directories.

security_module.name: Restrict use of Mesg command
security_module.description: Searches the home directories of all local user accounts for the use of "mesg -y". Any occurrences are replaces with "mesg -n" to prevent users from adjusting access to their own terminals.

security_module.name: Limit Term Write-access to Owner
security_module.description: Restricts write-access to a user's terminal to only that user.

option.name: filesToSearch
option.description: Files to Search ('free' text, supports quotes and shell 'globbing')

security_module.name: Sync Shells File
security_module.description: Configures /etc/shells to contain shells assigned to users in /etc/passwd.

security_module.name: User Dot File Perms
security_module.description: Prevents user dot files from being writable by other users. User dot files are local initialization files located in user's home directories. They are used by shells and other applications during startup. Typical user dot files include .bashrc and .profile.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: Lock account after three failed login attempts
security_module.description: Accounts are often compromised through the use of brute force account name and password guessing attempts. These attempts can be partially prevented by implementing account locking on your system. When an attacker attempts to force open an account, the account becomes locked after three failed login attempts.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: Set delay after failed login
security_module.description: Controls login delay between login prompts after a failed login. The recommended parameter is at least four seconds.

option.name: loginDelay
option.description: The number of seconds the system will wait after a failed login before redisplaying the login prompt.

security_module.name: Maximum Number of Logins per User
security_module.description: Controls the maximum number of concurrent logins by any particular user./

option.name: maxLoginsByUser
option.description: Maximum number of concurrent logins per user.

security_module.name: Set CDE Screen Saver
security_module.description: Configures timeout and activation values for the screen saver program for all Solaris Common Desktop Environment (CDE) users.

option.name: cdeSaverActivate
option.description: Number of minutes a graphical CDE session can be idle before a password protected screen saver is activated.

security_module.name: Set Mandatory Screen Saver
security_module.description: Configures mandatory timeout and activation values for the screen saver program for all users of the GNOME desktop.

option.name: gnomeSaverActivate
option.description: Number of minutes a graphical GNOME session can be idle before a password protected screen saver is activated.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: Set X Screen Saver Application Defaults
security_module.description: Configures the default timeout and activation values for the X screen saver program.

option.name: XscreenSaverActivate
option.description: Number of minutes a graphical X Windows session can be idle before a password protected screen saver is activated.

security_module.name: Set shell timeout period
security_module.description: Sets shell session timeout. Any shell session that is idle for longer than the specified time will be disconnected.

option.name: shellTimeout
option.description: Number of seconds a shell can be idle before the system automatically terminates the session.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: Disable Firefox if older than 3.0
security_module.description: Disables the Firefox browser if the currently installed version is not at least 3.0. This module will set the permissions on the firefox file to zeros, preventing it from being executed.

security_module.name: Disable Squid
security_module.description: Squid is a caching proxy server used to increase web transaction speed.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: Disable Squid if older than 2.4STABLE6
security_module.description: Disables the Squid service if the currently installed version is at least 2.4.STABLE6. When this module was written, prior versions of Squid had vulnerabilties including a vulnerability in the authentication header.

security_module.name: Disable WBEM
security_module.description: Disables the Solaris Web-Based Enterprise Management (WBEM) services.

security_module.name: Disable Apache
security_module.description: Disables Apache, which is an HTTP server.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: Disable Tux
security_module.description: Disables Tux, which is a kernel-based web server. It increases performance but is less flexible than a traditional web server like Apache.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: Disable Java Web Console
security_module.description: Disables the Solaris Java Web Console (smcwebserver(1M)).

security_module.name: Firefox - Add-ons
security_module.description: Disable the automatic updating of Mozilla Firefox extensions (Addons).

security_module.name: Firefox - Dynamic Content
security_module.description: Provide protections against dynamic content such as scripts and native browser objects which can change the content of a brwoser window without the knowledge of a user.

security_module.name: Firefox - Encryption
security_module.description: Mozilla Firefox browser encryption settings.

security_module.name: Firefox - Java
security_module.description: Mozilla Firefox browser settings for Java.

security_module.name: Firefox - JavaScript
security_module.description: Mozilla Firefox browser settings for Javascript.

security_module.name: Firefox - Network
security_module.description: Mozilla Firefox browser network settings.

security_module.name: Configure User Firefox Prefs
security_module.description: This module has been retired. It has been expanded to multiple modules.

security_module.name: Firefox - Privacy
security_module.description: Mozilla Firefox browser settings for privacy.

security_module.name: Firefox - Updating
security_module.description: Mozilla Firefox browser settings for auto updates.

security_module.name: PHP - Disallow HTTP File Uploads
security_module.description: Disallows file uploads to your server via HTTP.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: PHP - General Security
security_module.description: Configures the PHP framework to help protect web applications from security defects, ranging from insufficient validation to application logic errors.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5

security_module.name: PHP - Remove stored MySQL Password
security_module.description: Removes the default MySQL password stored in the global PHP configuration file. The default PHP configuration has no password set. Configuring PHP with a default database password is not recommended. It is possible for anyone with PHP command access to get the database password from /etc/php.ini with the get_cfg_var() function.

security_module.name: PHP - Enhance Session Management
security_module.description: Enhances the PHP session management for web applications.

security_module.name: PHP - Set Error Logging
security_module.description: Sets logging parameters for the PHP framework so that all web application errors are logged but not displayed in the end-user web browsers.

line-item.name: Guide to the Secure Configuration of RHEL5
